The CrawlURI.getContentSize() should return the number of bytes in the
down=
loaded document (minus headers). I belive that for HTTP docs, this is
set b=
y the FetchHTTP processor (DNS size is written by the
ArcWriterProcessor wh=
ich seems silly).

The StatisticsTracker uses this info, so for URIs that h=
ave a status code >
0 this should contain valid info after those processors=
 are completed.

Alternatively, I suppose the following would work in a pro=
cessor (for HTTP
uris, not DNS and only after the FetchHTTP processor)

 Re=
playCharSequence cs =3D curi.getHttpRecorder().getReplayCharSequence();
 lo=
ng size =3D cs.length();

- Kris
